cv

For a brief version of this, see the PDF version downloadable on the right.

Research Interests

  • Machine learning and artificial intelligence with a focus on core learning methodology and their applications in finance, healthcare, and their social impact.

Education

  • 2018-now
    Carnegie Mellon University – Ph.D. in Machine Learning.
    • Advisor: Prof. Zackary Lipton.
  • 2015-2016
    West Virginia University – M.S. in Electrical Engineering.
    • Advisors: Prof. Roy Nutter and Prof. Katerina Goseva-Popstojanova.
    • Thesis: The Automatic Detection and Classification of Security Vulnerabilities in Issue Tracking Systems.
    • Area of Emphasis: Computer Systems and Cybersecurity
  • 2009-13
    West Virginia University – B.S. in Electrical Engineering.
    • Area of Emphasis: Bioengineering and Biometrics
    • Graduated Magna Cum Laude from the Honors College.

Work Experience

  • 2017-now
    Electronics Engineer at the U.S. Army Research Laboratory
    • I was the technical integration lead for The Technical Cooperation Program (TTCP) Contested Urban Environment (CUE) strategic challenge. See here for more information.
    • As part of a small team, I designed, developed, and maintained the Open Standard for Unattended Sensors.
    • Lead many projects.
    • TS/SCI Clearance.
    • From 2017-2018, I worked in the Network Sensing and Fusion Branch where we focused on combining information from many multi-modal sensors to make intelligent decisions and predictions.
    • Since 2018, I am part of the Context Aware Processing Branch where we focus on the theoretical underpinnings of data fusion.
  • 2016
    Graduate Research Assistant under Prof. Goseva-Popstojanova at WVU.
    • Built a system for NASA that was used to classify software issues as potential security threats or not. This system was implemented and used to prioritize the urgency of which to solve current issues.
  • 2015-2016
    Graduate Research Assistant under Prof. Roy Nutter at WVU.
    • Built a system that makes a dossier of a person based on personally identifiable information, including images. The dossier included a profile measuring an individuals exposure on the internet. See the project for more details.
  • 2015
    Systems Technician at WVU Engineering School Help Desk.
  • 2015
    Day Trader at Hold Brothers Captial.
  • 2014
    Proprietor, Tyo Drafting and Design.
    • Provided drafting and design services to a few local businesses.
  • 2014
    Electrical Engineer Intern at Catawba Nuclear Station.
    • Developed a plan to upgrade a subsection of the plants valve controllers and integrate them into the DCS.
  • 2013-2014
    Research Intern at WVU Department of Biochemistry.
    • Utilized R and Python to perform data analysis on several genomic projects in Dr. Peter Stoilov's lab.
  • 2013
    Electrical Engineer Intern at Jacobs Engineering.
  • 2012-2013
    Sales Advisor at Vector Marketing.
  • 2012
    Electrical Engineer Intern at Taggart Global.
  • 2011
    Electrical Engineer Intern at Taggart Global.

Honors and Awards

  • 2020
    • Received computation grant from the Pittsburgh Supercomputing Center.
  • 2012
    • Recipient of the IEEE Power and Energy Society PLUS scholarship.
  • 2011
    • Health Sciences and Technology Academy (HSTA) member and scholarship recipient.
    • Students of Excellence Scholarship Recipient.
    • Mountaineer Scholarship Recipient.
    • Engineering Achievement Scholarship Recipient.

Services
